      • SoloRemoteControl

      • createProtocolRunner

        protected boolean createProtocolRunner()
        Invoked from start(). Creates the default instance of our Runner.
        Returns:
        true to allow normal execution to proceed. Returning false should cause an abort of the test startup procedure.
        See Also:
        start()

      • startProtocolRunner

        protected boolean startProtocolRunner()
        Invoked from start(). Creates the default instance of the runnerThread providing the current Runner as its Runnable argument. The runnerThread is then immediately started.
        Returns:
        true to allow normal execution to proceed. Returning false should cause an abort of the test startup procedure.
        See Also:
        start()

      • start

        public void start()
           throws java.lang.IllegalThreadStateException
        Creates and Starts the asynchronous RemoteControl runner.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalThreadStateException - if we were unable to create and run the protocol runner.

      • modifyEmbeddedProtocol

        protected void modifyEmbeddedProtocol()
        In this method, we can modify some properties of the embedded protocol DroidSocketProtocol.
        Note: this method MUST be called after createProtocolRunner() and before startProtocolRunner(). Just like in start().
        For example, we can modify the controllerPort as SocketProtocol.setControllerPort(int)
        or modify portForwarding as DroidSocketProtocol.setPortForwarding(boolean)
        If the 'port forwarding' is set to true, we MUST call DroidSocketProtocol.adjustControllerPort() to choose an available port for 'controller'.
        See Also:
        start(), SocketProtocol.setControllerPort(int), DroidSocketProtocol.setPortForwarding(boolean), DroidSocketProtocol.adjustControllerPort()

      • setControllerPort

        public void setControllerPort(int controllerPort)
        Set the 'controller port' where we will connect for messenger service.
        The 'controller port' should be an available port, if it is not, it will be
        modified to an available one in method modifyEmbeddedProtocol()
        Parameters:
        controllerPort - int, an available port number
        See Also:
        modifyEmbeddedProtocol()

      • setPortForwarding

        public void setPortForwarding(boolean portForwarding)
        Set if we will forward 'controller port' to remote messenger service's port. Must be set before start() is called to have affect.
        Parameters:
        portForwarding - set true if the controller should attempt port forwarding before starting the runner thread.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Command the RemoteControl infrastructure to shutdown.
        See Also:
        AbstractProtocolRunner.shutdownThread()

      • resetResults

        public void resetResults()
        reset the results fields and properties prior to dispatching a request. remoteResult = false
        remoteResultCode = -99
        remoteResultInfo = null
        remoteResultProperties = null
        remoteComment = null
        remoteDetail = null

      • resetReady

        protected void resetReady()
        Used internally. Reset the ready field--normally immediately after having received it. remoteReady = false

      • consolidateResults

        protected java.util.Properties consolidateResults()
        Consolidates the remoteResult, remoteResultCode, and remoteResultInfo into any remoteResultProperties. If remoteResultProperties is null, the routine will create the Properties object before the consolidation. remoteResultInfo will only be written to the Properties if it is a non-null String value. The routine will NOT overwrite any of these remoteResult properties if they already exist in the remoteResultProperties object.
        Returns:
        remoteResultProperties

      • debug

        public void debug(java.lang.String message)

      • checkExceptions

        protected void checkExceptions()
                        throws RemoteException,
                               ShutdownInvocationException
        Throw a ShutdownInvocationException only *IF* we have received a localShutdown or remoteShutdown message. Throw a RemoteException only *IF* we have received a remoteException. Otherwise, this routine returns doing nothing.
        Throws:
        ShutdownInvocationException - if localShutdown or remoteShutdown have been received.
        RemoteException - if remoteException has been received.

      • waitForRemoteConnected

        public void waitForRemoteConnected(int sTimeout)
                            throws java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException,
                                   RemoteException,
                                   ShutdownInvocationException
        Wait for the remote client to get connected. This is typically called from an external Thread.
        Parameters:
        sTimeout - in seconds to wait for connection. If timeout is < 1 then the there is no wait.
        Throws:
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - if connection was not made in the timeout period.
        RemoteException - if we received an unexpected remote exception instead.
        ShutdownInvocationException - if either a local or remote shutdown has been initiated.

      • notifyConnectionListeners

        protected void notifyConnectionListeners()

      • waitForRemoteReady

        public void waitForRemoteReady(int sTimeout)
                        throws java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException,
                               RemoteException,
                               ShutdownInvocationException
        Wait for the remote client to signal Ready for a new command. This is typically called from an external Thread.
        Parameters:
        sTimeout - in seconds to wait for ready. If timeout is < 1 then there is no wait.
        Throws:
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - if Ready was not seen in the timeout period.
        RemoteException - if we received an unexpected remote exception instead.
        ShutdownInvocationException - if either a local or remote shutdown has been initiated.

      • notifyReadyListeners

        protected void notifyReadyListeners()

      • performRemotePropsCommand

        public java.util.Properties performRemotePropsCommand(java.util.Properties props,
                                             int secsWaitReady,
                                             int secsWaitRunning,
                                             int secsWaitResult)
                                               throws java.lang.IllegalThreadStateException,
                                                      RemoteException,
                                                      java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException,
                                                      ShutdownInvocationException
        Default implementation performs the following: 

         resetResults();
 waitForRemoteReady(secsWaitReady);
 runner.sendDispatchProps(props);
 waitForRemoteRunning(secsWaitRunning);
 return waitForRemoteResult(secsWaitResult);
        Parameters:
        props - - the Dispatch Properties object containing all required command parameters for the remote client.
        secsWaitRead - -- timeout in seconds to detect remoteReady.
        secsWaitRunning - -- timeout in seconds to detect remoteRunning following the dispatch.
        secsWaitResults - -- timeout in seconds to wait for results from the remote client.
        Returns:
        - the Result Properties returned by the remote client.
        Throws:
        ShutdownInvocationException
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        RemoteException
        java.lang.IllegalThreadStateException - -- if the attempt to send the properties failed for some unknown reason.
        See Also:
        SoloRemoteControlRunner.sendDispatchProps(Properties)

      • performRemoteFileCommand

        public java.util.Properties performRemoteFileCommand(java.lang.String filepath,
                                            int secsWaitReady,
                                            int secsWaitRunning,
                                            int secsWaitResult)
                                              throws java.lang.IllegalThreadStateException,
                                                     RemoteException,
                                                     java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException,
                                                     ShutdownInvocationException
        Default implementation performs the following: 

         resetResults();
 waitForRemoteReady(secsWaitReady);
 runner.sendDispatchFile(filepath);
 waitForRemoteRunning(secsWaitRunning);
 return waitForRemoteResult(secsWaitResult);
        Parameters:
        filepath - - the filepath to the File to process.
        secsWaitRead - -- timeout in seconds to detect remoteReady.
        secsWaitRunning - -- timeout in seconds to detect remoteRunning following the dispatch.
        secsWaitResults - -- timeout in seconds to wait for results from the remote client.
        Returns:
        - the Result Properties returned by the remote client.
        Throws:
        ShutdownInvocationException
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        RemoteException
        java.lang.IllegalThreadStateException - -- if the attempt to send failed for some unknown reason.
        See Also:
        SoloRemoteControlRunner.sendDispatchProps(Properties)

      • performRemoteMessageCommand

        public void performRemoteMessageCommand(java.lang.String message,
                               int secsWaitReady,
                               int secsWaitRunning)
                                 throws java.lang.IllegalThreadStateException,
                                        RemoteException,
                                        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException,
                                        ShutdownInvocationException
        Default implementation performs the following: 

         resetResults();
 waitForRemoteReady(secsWaitReady);
 runner.sendMessage(message);
 waitForRemoteRunning(secsWaitRunning);

        The routine does NOT waitForResults. This allows arbitrary messaging not always expecting a response.

        Parameters:
        message - to send to remote client
        secsWaitRead - -- timeout in seconds to detect remoteReady.
        secsWaitRunning - -- timeout in seconds to detect remoteRunning following the dispatch.
        secsWaitResults - -- timeout in seconds to wait for results from the remote client.
        Throws:
        ShutdownInvocationException
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        RemoteException
        java.lang.IllegalThreadStateException - -- if the attempt to send the message failed for some unknown reason.
        See Also:
        SoloRemoteControlRunner.sendDispatchProps(Properties)

      • performRemoteShutdown

        public void performRemoteShutdown(int secsWaitReady,
                         int secsWaitRunning,
                         int secsWaitShutdown)
                           throws java.lang.IllegalThreadStateException,
                                  RemoteException,
                                  java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException,
                                  ShutdownInvocationException
        Default implementation performs the following: 

         resetResults();
 waitForRemoteReady(secsWaitReady);
 runner.sendShutdown();
 waitForRemoteRunning(secsWaitRunning);

        The routine does NOT waitForResults. This allows arbitrary messaging not always expecting a response.

        Parameters:
        message - to send to remote client
        secsWaitRead - -- timeout in seconds to detect remoteReady.
        secsWaitRunning - -- timeout in seconds to detect remoteRunning following the dispatch.
        secsWaitShutdown - -- timeout in seconds to wait to receive shutdown confirmation.
        Throws:
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException
        RemoteException
        java.lang.IllegalThreadStateException - -- if the attempt to send the message failed for some unknown reason.
        ShutdownInvocationException
        See Also:
        SoloRemoteControlRunner.sendDispatchProps(Properties)

      • waitForRemoteRunning

        public void waitForRemoteRunning(int sTimeout)
                          throws java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException,
                                 RemoteException,
                                 ShutdownInvocationException
        Wait for the remote client to signal Running a new command. This is typically called from an external Thread.
        Parameters:
        sTimeout - in seconds to wait for Running. If timeout is < 1 then there is no wait.
        Throws:
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - if Running was not seen in the timeout period.
        RemoteException - if we received an unexpected remote exception instead.
        ShutdownInvocationException - if either a local or remote shutdown has been initiated.

      • notifyRunningListeners

        protected void notifyRunningListeners()

      • waitForRemoteResult

        public java.util.Properties waitForRemoteResult(int sTimeout)
                                         throws java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException,
                                                RemoteException,
                                                ShutdownInvocationException
        Wait for the remote client to signal results are available and return those results. This is typically called from an external Thread immediately following a "dispatch" call.

        When a valid remote result has been received it is first checked for the presence of a special property . If that key is present then the property value is processed for a new timeout value and the routine waits for a new remote result using the new timeout value. If no new timeout is provided, or the format is non-numeric, the routine will simply wait again using the original sTimeout value.

        Parameters:
        sTimeout - in seconds to wait for Results. If timeout is < 1 then there is no wait.
        Returns:
        Properties -- the resultProps returned from the remote client or a new Properties object containing the consolidated remote result information.
        Throws:
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - if Results was not seen in the timeout period.
        RemoteException - if we received an unexpected remote exception instead.
        ShutdownInvocationException - if either a local or remote shutdown has been initiated.
        See Also:
        consolidateResults()

      • notifyResultsListeners

        protected void notifyResultsListeners(int rc,
                          java.lang.String info)

      • notifyResultPropsListeners

        protected void notifyResultPropsListeners(java.util.Properties props)

      • waitForRemoteShutdown

        public void waitForRemoteShutdown(int sTimeout)
                           throws java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException,
                                  RemoteException
        Wait for the remote client to signal its shutdown. This is typically called from an external Thread.
        Parameters:
        sTimeout - in seconds to wait for shutdown. If timeout is < 1 then there is no wait.
        Throws:
        java.util.concurrent.TimeoutException - if shutdown was not seen in the timeout period.
        RemoteException - if we received an unexpected remote exception instead.
